Real Student Success, In Their Own Words

These are genuine stories from students and parents who trusted GG Maths. Each journey celebrates hard work, newfound confidence, and the fantastic results that followed.

Book a Free Consultation

From Grade 3 to Grade 7 — Ben’s Incredible GCSE Maths Journey

“I started Year 11 on a Grade 3. By exam day, I achieved a Grade 7. It was unbelievable.”

Ben began Year 11 at a Grade 3 in GCSE Maths, lacking confidence after years of gaps in his foundations. With a targeted approach — tackling topics step by step and mastering each before moving on — his skills and confidence grew rapidly. In just nine months, he achieved a Grade 7 in his GCSEs, a remarkable four-grade improvement that transformed his outlook on maths and learning.

GCSE

Kiran’s Maths Journey — From Predicted Grade 6 at GCSE to A at A-Level

“I was aiming for a 6 or 7. Getting a 9 was a huge surprise and a great achievement.”

Kiran joined GG Maths in Year 10, predicted a Grade 6 in GCSE Maths. With tailored lessons and step-by-step guidance, he turned weaknesses into strengths, achieving a top 2% Grade 9 at GCSE. Carrying this mindset into A-Level, we fast-tracked Year 12 content, giving him extra time for Year 13’s toughest topics. The result: an A in A-Level Maths and a place at University of Birmingham to study Mathematics and Music.

GCSE A-Level

Adrian — From Struggling in Year 7 to Confident in Year 9

“In less than six months, he started picking it up and he started performing at above 80%.”

When Adrian joined GG Maths in Year 7, his maths results were below 50%. With one-to-one tutoring, clear step-by-step lessons, and targeted homework, he rebuilt his skills and confidence. In just six months, his marks rose to 85%. Now, learning topics ahead of class gives him a clear edge — proof that the right support can turn setbacks into success.

KS3 Year 8

Akbar — A-Level Achievement

“I started Year 12 at a grade C. Within two months, I was scoring an A — and by exam day, I achieved it.”

Akbar entered Year 12 struggling with confidence and scoring around a C in assessments. By learning topics ahead of school, finishing the syllabus early, and tackling A* questions, he rapidly improved. Within two months he was scoring an A in mocks and went on to achieve an A at A-Level before starting Computer Science at Queen Mary University.

A-Level
